Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini has expressed disappointment in midfielder Yaya Toure's performance this season, acknowledging that neither he nor Toure is happy with the latter's level of play. Despite this, Pellegrini has vowed to support Toure until the end of the season. Sportsmail has reported that Manchester City would consider offers for Toure in the summer as part of a squad overhaul. Toure, who has two years left on his contract, has faced criticism during City's struggling Premier League campaign. Pellegrini, whose own future is uncertain, maintains that Toure is an important player. City faces West Ham without captain Vincent Kompany, who may miss the rest of the season due to injury. City goalkeeper Joe Hart has stated that the players should take responsibility for their performances and that they have let the manager down. Hart also affirmed that Pellegrini has the support of the dressing room. Meanwhile, West Ham manager Sam Allardyce has cautioned Aaron Cresswell about the potential pitfalls of moving to a big club like Manchester City, referencing the limited playing time experienced by Jack Rodwell and Scott Sinclair at City.

domenico rancadore, a sicilian mafia member known as the 'godfather of uxbridge,' will not be extradited to italy as his sentence has been dropped. rancadore, who has lived in the uk for over 20 years, was given a seven-year sentence by an italian court in 1999 for being a member of the cosa nostra. however, his case expired last october, and his european arrest warrant is to be withdrawn. although his conviction remains, italian law states that a sentence is extinguished once a period of more than double the time of the penalty has passed. rancadore's solicitor, karen todner, is confident that the italian government will now withdraw their application for a european arrest warrant and that rancadore will be discharged from these proceedings. the italian mobster does not have to be present when the matter is dealt with in court. the case will still have to be heard by the italian supreme court.

Mr Mole, ridden by AP McCoy, is one of three 7-2 co-favourites in the seven-runner line-up for the Grade One Celebration Chase at Sandown on Saturday. He is bracketed with Irish raider Special Tiara and Nicky Henderson's Sprinter Sacre, who will be ridden by Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Nico de Boinville. Mr Mole will be McCoy's last ride in a Grade One race, and his book of rides for his final day as a professional jockey will be finalised on Friday morning. Other runners in the race include Mick Channon's Somersby.

Virginia Trimble Ritter, the mother of Marcia Trimble who was murdered in 1975, has recently seen crime scene photos of her daughter's body after declining to view them for over 40 years. Marcia was raped and strangled by Jerome Sydney Barrett, who was convicted of her second-degree murder in 2009 and sentenced to 44 years in prison. Ritter's then-husband had advised her against seeing the body or the photos, wanting to preserve their memory of her as she was. Upon seeing the photos, Ritter expressed a desire for revenge, noting the horrific condition of her daughter's body. The case, involving the murder of 11-year-old Marcia, was Nashville's most notorious unsolved murder for 33 years until Barrett's DNA matched evidence from the crime scene.

Rory McIlroy, the world number one golfer, is determined to win the Masters at some point in his career to complete the career grand slam, joining an elite group of only five other players. He reflects on his final-round collapse at Augusta National in 2011 as the most important day of his career, as it taught him valuable lessons that he applied to win subsequent major titles. McIlroy, 25, has set a long-term goal to win at Augusta, considering it a special achievement to win every major due to their varying tests and conditions. Despite having only one top-10 finish in six Masters appearances, McIlroy is confident in his ability to win multiple times at the course. He believes that winning the Masters is not just a desire but an expectation in his career, and not achieving it would be a significant disappointment. McIlroy's success in 2014, despite personal and professional distractions, has strengthened his resolve to use the golf course as a sanctuary from the pressure and hype surrounding Augusta.

The passage highlights several trending stories from a busy week. Key events include the appearance of four rainbows over New York after heavy rain, captured by fashion CEO Amanda Curtis. In China, the hiring of exotic dancers for wakes is becoming common, but faces a crackdown. Actor Robert Downey Jr. (RDJ) showed irritation during a UK interview when questioned about his private life. The 'Kylie Jenner Challenge' emerged as a trend, involving using jars to plump lips. A 102-year-old woman, Alice Barker, revisited her past with the help of filmmakers. A school rejected a prom invitation referencing bombs, leading to accusations of racism. Ewan McGregor is set to play Lumiere in 'Beauty and the Beast', generating social media buzz. Johnny Depp's transformation for 'Black Mass' trailer was noted. A pregnancy announcement was creatively linked to "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air." Lastly, a military father photobombed his son's photo, earning praise for originality.

the passage discusses the serious issue of foetal alcohol syndrome (fas) in the uk, revealing that 272 children diagnosed with fas were hospitalised in england over the past 12 months. experts warn that the actual number affected by prenatal alcohol exposure could be much higher, with world health organisation research suggesting that at least 1 in 100 uk babies may suffer from learning, behavioural, and physical problems due to alcohol exposure in the womb. this equates to approximately 7,500 babies per year. the condition is described as an 'enormous problem' and 'vastly under-diagnosed' by elizabeth mitchell of the national organisation for foetal alcohol syndrome. the story of niamh brown, a 15-year-old with fas who requires assistance with daily tasks and will never live independently, highlights the lifelong impact of the syndrome. niamh's adoptive parents established the foetal alcohol spectrum disorder trust to support others. additional medical issues linked to alcohol consumption during pregnancy include liver, kidney, and heart problems, cerebral palsy, sight loss, and epilepsy. the uk government advises pregnant women to abstain from alcohol, recommending no more than two units of alcohol no more than twice a week if they choose to drink, although mitchell suggests this guidance should be revised to recommend complete abstinence.

A man named Shaun Andrew Mckerry, known in his youth as 'Boomerang Boy' or 'Homing Pigeon Boy', attempted to rob Shildon Post Office and Stores in County Durham with an axe. The shop owner, Sab Dhillon, tackled Mckerry to the floor, and Dhillon's wife, Sam, hit Mckerry with a baseball bat, helping to disarm him. The police arrived and arrested Mckerry, who has a history of crime since the age of 12, including 80 arrests by the age of 15. Mckerry pleaded guilty to attempted robbery and was sentenced to six years in jail.

four royal navy sailors, charged with gang-raping a young woman at a canadian barracks, must remain in nova scotia until their trial. they appeared in court in dartmouth, near halifax, and were granted bail with unusual conditions, potentially requiring them to live on a canadian naval base for years. bail was set at over £2,000 each, and they agreed to surrender their passports and live at the stadacona naval base in halifax. the accused are joshua finbow, 23, a submarine engineer; simon radford, 31; craig stoner, 24; and darren smalley, 35. they will continue to work for the royal navy and receive their current pay under a deal with the british government. the alleged assault occurred on april 10 after a hockey game, and the victim was a young woman in her early 20s. the sailors were ordered to return to court on may 27 and are forbidden from contacting the victim and six witnesses. they must remain employed by the navy and cannot resign without the court's permission. the investigation is ongoing, and additional charges may be filed based on forensic test results.

the summary is as follows:

a mother whose son has a rare skin disease was accused of child abuse after a stranger mistook his condition for burns and called the police. four-year-old rj jackson has netherton's syndrome, which makes his skin appear red and scaly. his mother, valerie jackson, was shopping with him when armed police surrounded her, acting on a report of suspected abuse. valerie regularly applies creams to rj's skin to alleviate his symptoms, but they have faced ignorance and cruelty from others, including being denied entry to play centers and enduring taunts, mostly from adults. netherton's syndrome is a congenital skin disease with no cure, but symptoms often improve over time. the jacksons discovered rj's condition through an online support group after his birth, when he appeared with a severe rash and was rushed to intensive care. despite the challenges, valerie sees her son as beautiful and hopes for greater awareness and understanding of his condition.

the controversial 'are you beach body ready?' protein world adverts featuring a bikini-clad model have been removed from the london underground by transport for london (tfl) at the end of the three-week advertising period. the campaign sparked outrage among body image campaigners and feminists, leading to a change.org petition garnering over 50,000 signatures and over 200 complaints to the advertising standards authority (asa). tfl stated it would consider the public reaction if similar ads were proposed in the future. the removal coincides with a planned protest against protein world in hyde park, which has gained significant support on social media. despite the backlash, protein world defended the campaign, claiming it aimed to promote health and fitness. the company's head of global marketing, richard staveley, appeared on good morning britain, where he faced criticism from presenter susanna reid, who found the advert 'anxiety inducing.' staveley maintained that the campaign was successful and that the company would not change its advertising approach. the asa is assessing the complaints to determine if further action is warranted. sales of protein powder in the uk have surged, with the market expected to reach £358m by 2017. not all public figures condemned the campaign; katie hopkins and writer samantha brick supported protein world, with brick even stating the ad influenced her decision to purchase a bikini.

Here is a summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information described:

- Rail firms are planning fare hikes of up to 87% just ten days after the general election, despite party leaders pledging to freeze prices.
- The Prime Minister has requested First Great Western (FGW) to urgently review its decision to almost double some fares on the route between London and the Cotswolds, which passes through his Witney constituency.
- Passengers traveling from Charlbury, the Oxfordshire station nearest to the Prime Minister's constituency home, will see an 87% increase in off-peak return fares to London from May 17.
- The planned changes have angered the Prime Minister's constituents, prompting him to personally intervene.
- Train companies have three windows every year to increase 'unregulated' fares, which make up around half of their total revenue.
- FGW has insisted the reason for the change is to bring the North Cotswolds route in line with its other services.
- Other sharp price hikes include an off-peak first-class single from Crewe to Northampton on London Midland, which will rise from £30 to £37, and an anytime return between Stafford and Liverpool, traveling with Virgin, which will leap from £26.50 to £33.
- Virgin has said the 'vast majority' of its price hikes affected 'Virgin trains-only fares,' which are at least 20% cheaper than tickets offered by rival firms.
- The overall fare increase this year on the West Coast is just 1.65%, well below the industry average, according to Virgin.

john young, a 66-year-old former soldier, was left blinded in one eye after being hit by a brick thrown by vandals at his home in oldham, greater manchester. young and his new wife elaine were in their front room when the attackers began throwing stones at their front window. when young confronted the attackers, he was struck in the left eye by another brick, causing an open wound to his forehead and serious injury to his eye. despite emergency surgery, doctors could not save his eyesight. the attack occurred three weeks after the couple's wedding. police are investigating but have found no motive, suggesting it could be a case of yobs 'messing around.' the couple feels unsafe in their home and plans to move.

Tom Poynton, a 25-year-old wicketkeeper for Derbyshire, has signed a one-year contract extension following his successful comeback from a leg injury sustained in a road accident that claimed his father's life in April 2014. After undergoing an ankle operation, Poynton made his return during Derbyshire's pre-season tour of Abu Dhabi. The new contract secures his commitment to the team until the end of the 2016 season. Derbyshire's elite performance director, Graeme Welch, praised Poynton's character and hard work, expressing hope that the new contract will boost his confidence and performance.

five-year-old harley renshaw, who was diagnosed with neuroblastoma, a rare and aggressive form of cancer, has been declared cancer-free by doctors after a year of battling the disease. harley, who had cancer in his kidney, neck, lungs, and bones, used a ninja turtle mask during his radiotherapy treatments to feel stronger and braver. the hospital staff were impressed when he asked to decorate his protective mask. after his story gained international attention, nickelodeon sent him a box of ninja turtle presents for christmas. harley underwent 80 days of intensive chemotherapy, an operation to remove a kidney tumor, a stem cell transplant, and weeks of radiotherapy. his bravery earned him a little star award from cancer research uk and made him the face of their kids and teens campaign. neuroblastoma affects fewer than 100 children in the uk each year, usually starting in the adrenal glands or nerve tissues and can spread to other parts of the body. symptoms vary depending on the tumor's location and can include tiredness, loss of appetite, and bone pain. treatment options include surgery, chemotherapy, antibody treatment, and radiotherapy. harley's parents, oliver and stacey renshaw, are overjoyed and hopeful that he will soon return to school full-time.

The passage discusses the situation of Aston Villa's 19-year-old player, Jack Grealish, who is being pursued by both the Republic of Ireland and England for international play. Aston Villa's manager, Tim Sherwood, advises Grealish to focus on his club career and continue to earn his place in the Villa first team. Grealish's performance in the FA Cup semi-final win over Liverpool has put him in the spotlight. Sherwood emphasizes that the decision on which country to represent should be based on Grealish's personal identity and should be made after he has gained more experience with Aston Villa. Grealish's father, Kevin, agrees with Sherwood's advice, stating that Jack should concentrate on his club football before making a decision on his international future. The article mentions that Grealish is currently undecided between the two countries and that a friendly match could potentially allow him to play for both teams before making a final choice.

The passage discusses the varying and often high landing fees charged to private jets at different airports around the world, highlighting the luxury and cost associated with private jet travel. Surprisingly, some less expected hubs like Salzburg and Darwin have high fees. Private jet travel is a growing trend among the wealthy, with significant activity during major sporting events like the Super Bowl and the Monaco Grand Prix. The market is worth trillions in the US and Europe. The top 10 most expensive airports for landing fees are listed, with Haneda Airport in Tokyo being the most expensive, followed by other Japanese airports and locations in Canada, Australia, the UK, and the US. The fees can reach thousands of dollars, adding to the overall cost of private jet ownership and usage.

The passage describes a video featuring Cooper, a Labrador, and Daisy, a small female dog, enjoying treats at fast-food outlets, which has been viewed over seven million times. Katie Gallegos, from Clackamas County, Oregon, takes the dogs to a McDonald's drive-thru for ice cream, where Daisy licks her treat daintily, while Cooper consumes his in one bite, reflecting his habit of eating quickly. Gallegos, who runs Dogpatch Resort, ensures Daisy eats first due to Cooper's rapid eating. The video has received mixed reactions, with some finding it amusing and others criticizing the feeding of ice cream to dogs. Gallegos defends the practice, stating Cooper is healthy and active, and compares it to her late dog Sammy's diet, who lived to 19 years old and also had weekly ice cream. Daisy, due to her size, gets fewer treats. Another video shows the dogs enjoying a 'pup-uccino' at Starbucks, with Cooper again consuming the entire cup quickly. Gallegos clarifies that the 'pup-uccino' contains only whipped cream, no coffee.

Gary Locke, who initially joined Kilmarnock as assistant boss to Allan Johnston, has been appointed as the permanent manager after signing a three-year deal. Locke, a former Hearts manager, took over the team in February when Johnston left and has since led the team to six wins in seven games. He will address the press about his new role on Friday morning.

A Florida mother, Jessica Kemp, has accused Seminole County Elementary School of threatening to suspend her 5-year-old autistic son, Logan, due to the essential oils she applies to him to help him stay calm and focused. The oils, produced by Doterra and featuring scents like lavender, chamomile, and sandalwood, were deemed a distraction and a smell issue by the school. Kemp has been using these oils on her son throughout the year, but a teacher's aide recently complained. Despite receiving a letter from the school board stating the oils caused problems, Kemp plans to contest the decision, emphasizing the oils' positive impact on her son. The Lake County School District later informed a local station that Logan would not be suspended, acknowledging it as a health issue.

A beach-side apartment complex in West Hampton, known as the Sandpiper complex, was destroyed by a massive fire on Wednesday afternoon. The blaze, which started around 3 PM, spread through 90 condos, causing the building to collapse. The cause of the fire is unknown, but it was intense enough to melt the paint off nearby buildings. Smoke from the fire could be seen from three miles away. Despite efforts from 12 fire crews, the flames could not be controlled, and the firefighters were unable to enter any of the summer homes. The complex, used as a holiday home by residents between May and November, was left in ruins. Janice Skolarek, an owner of one of the apartments, and Rob Taber, the building manager who lived and worked there, both reported losing everything. The fire's intensity affected nearby buildings, and the incident is under investigation, with claims that it may have started near a car parked by the complex.

the 88-year-old queen was seen enjoying a ride on her black fell pony, carltonlima emma, in windsor great park, opting for a silk scarf instead of a helmet. her love for horses began at age four with a shetland pony named peggy. despite a knee injury reducing her riding time, she remains an avid equestrian and breeds various horse and pony breeds, including fell ponies at hampton court and highland ponies at balmoral. fell ponies, known for their docility and hardiness, have a history dating back to the neolithic period and were valued by ancient tribes and invaders for their utility as pack animals and later as riding horses. the queen's grandchildren, including lady louise and james, viscount severn, also ride some of her horses and ponies.

A dispute over noise levels between two Brisbane neighbors resulted in the death of one man and manslaughter charges against the other. Leon Yeaman, 55, was allegedly killed by a single punch from 28-year-old Phillip Pama during an altercation outside their homes. Pama, a father of three who works night shifts, was reportedly sleeping when Yeaman was making noise. Pama's lawyer stated that Yeaman was known for his loud behavior. During the confrontation, Pama struck Yeaman, who later died at the scene. Pama was granted conditional bail, including surrendering his passport, adhering to a curfew, and regular police check-ins. The case is set for court on May 18. Neighbors and friends described Yeaman as kind and generous, mentioning he suffered from schizophrenia. Pama, with no prior violence history, is said to be deeply distressed by the incident.

Yulia Simonova, a 52-year-old music teacher, sought to hire a hitman to torture and murder her 15-year-old former lover, Damian Vanya, after he ended their relationship. She offered 100,000 rubles (approximately £1,400) for the job, specifying that she wanted the boy to suffer unbearable pain and bleed to death. Unbeknownst to her, police had set up a sting operation, with an undercover officer posing as the hitman. Simonova was filmed during the meeting where she detailed her demands. After she provided some expenses, she was arrested by armed police. Simonova now faces up to 15 years in prison on charges of attempted murder. Vanya, relieved by the outcome, expressed hope for a harsh sentence for Simonova.

The passage discusses Jose Mourinho, the Chelsea football manager, and his personal life, faith, and values. Key points include:

- Mourinho speaks to God daily but never about football, and he doesn't discuss the game with his wife.
- He and his family are aware of poverty and have worked with the World Food Programme as ambassadors against hunger.
- Mourinho tries to separate his professional life from his family life.
- He has a strong faith and prays every day, although he doesn't attend church regularly, except when in Portugal.
- Mourinho claims he only prays for personal matters, not related to football or Chelsea.
- Despite his competitive persona, he considers himself a good person, supportive of family, friends, and even strangers.
- He acknowledges making mistakes in his professional life, which he sees as separate from his personal identity.
- Mourinho was fined £25,000 for claiming there was a campaign against Chelsea earlier in the season.
- He is shown attending events with his family, indicating a private life distinct from his public persona.

Bob Barker, the former host of "The Price is Right," returned to the show for the first time in eight years on April 1. Barker, who originally hosted the show for 35 years until 2007, took charge of the first price-guessing game, "Lucky Seven," before handing over to current host Drew Carey. Despite being away from the show for most of the past eight years, Barker, at 91 years old, appeared to be in good form and did not miss a beat.

Here is a summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information described:
- An off-duty Secret Service agent, Arthur Baldwin, was arrested in Washington D.C. for attempting to break into a house.
- The arrest took place at 12:30 am on Friday on a residential street in South-Eastern D.C.
- Baldwin faces a felony charge of attempted burglary and destruction of property.
- He was arrested by the Metropolitan Police Department officers who returned to the scene of the alleged crime on the 3200 block of D Street SE.
- Baldwin's security clearance was revoked, and he was put on leave by the Secret Service.
- He was posted with the foreign missions branch of the service, which works with the State Department on diplomatic activities.
- Baldwin was to be arraigned on Friday afternoon, but no attorney was listed for him, and a telephone number could not be located.
- The arrest comes after a high-ranking supervisor was also put on leave for misconduct, which is being investigated by the police and the Homeland Security Department's Inspector General.
- The agency is responsible for protecting the president and his family, and these incidents are the latest in a series of issues for the Secret Service.

The passage describes a freelance photographer, Atif Saeed, who risked his life to photograph a hungry lion at Lahore's safari park. Saeed, leaving the safety of his car, crept up to within 10 feet of the lion and managed to take a few pictures before the shutter sound alerted the lion, prompting a rapid retreat. Saeed reflected on the encounter, noting the lion treated him as prey and that the close call, while initially amusing, made him unsure if he would attempt such a feat again.

The New York City Police Department (NYPD) is seeking to identify a woman who died on March 22 in the Gravesend section of Brooklyn. The woman, estimated to be between 25 and 45 years old, was found unconscious and later pronounced dead. She had no identification but featured a distinctive tattoo on her right leg, which appears to be a heart with the name 'Monique' and a rose. The tattoo was faded, and police have released images of it, including an artist's rendering of its original appearance. The cause of death is pending a medical examiner's report. The public is encouraged to contact NYPD Crime Stoppers with any information.

a new zealand couple , hannah and alex , built a solar-powered , two-bedroom home on the back of a 1986 hino flatbed truck after returning from the uk and finding they could not afford a traditional home. the project took a year and a half to complete and cost around $ 25,000. the home is mostly self-sufficient, powered by solar panels with a wood-fired stove and gas-powered hot water. it is situated on a lot they purchased in nelson, surrounded by nature. the couple plans to build another similar home in the future.

The passage discusses a study that found children sharing iPads in class perform significantly better in early literacy tests compared to those who do not use iPads or use them individually. The research, conducted by Courtney Blackwell from Northwestern University, involved 352 kindergarten students over an academic year. Shared iPad users scored approximately 30 points higher than their peers. The study suggests that collaborative learning around the technology is key to its effectiveness in improving literacy. The findings are to be presented at the 65th annual conference of the International Communication Association in Puerto Rico.

The passage describes a two-legged piglet that has become an internet sensation due to its ability to walk on its front trotters. Born without hind legs, the piglet, nicknamed 'Super Pig,' has mastered balancing and taking unsteady steps, often with its snout to the ground foraging for food. Despite the challenges, it mixes well with its fully-legged siblings. The piglet belongs to a farmer in Qionglai City, Sichuan Province, South Western China, and has attracted the attention of villagers and thousands online since a video of its remarkable ability went viral. This is not the first instance of a two-legged animal gaining popularity in China; a rabbit at Liuzhou Zoo also became a star for walking on its front paws, drawing tourists in Guangxi Province.

During the inaugural IndyCar Grand Prix of Louisiana, a pit crew member named Todd Phillips, who works as a front-outside tire changer for Dale Coyne Racing, was injured when he was hit by Francesco Dracone's car. Dracone had entered the pit on lap 25 for tires and fuel and spun while exiting, striking Phillips' leg. Phillips was treated at the infield care center for a cut on his leg, received stitches, and was released. Dracone did not finish the race and was placed 23rd. The race saw many cars struggling with traction due to rain prior to the start.

The passage details a brutal incident where Milton Vieira Severiano, 32, attacked and killed his wife, Cicera Alves de Sena, 29, a dancer with the group Jaula das Gostozuedas, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Severiano confessed to smashing her head into concrete 11 times and shooting her in the face five times due to jealousy over other men's attention towards her. The assault was captured on CCTV. After the murder, he stole a car but was apprehended by police following a crash. Police discovered four handguns, a shotgun, and a bulletproof vest in his vehicle. Severiano faces a potential life sentence. The incident occurred four days after their marriage, and a neighbor reported hearing a heated argument before the gunshots.

The passage discusses Sarah Wilson, a journalist and author, who candidly shares her struggle with mental illness, particularly anxiety, which led her to contemplate suicide. Wilson, aged 41, felt her life lacked meaning and she couldn't see a way out due to a combination of stress, anxiety, thyroid disease, and feelings of isolation. She mentions not having a partner or children contributed to her sense of loneliness. Wilson acknowledges that while she has always been an anxious person, she now finds peace with it. She emphasizes the link between depression and anxiety, suggesting that recognizing this connection could help address the rising rates of stress and anxiety among Australian women. Wilson views anxiety as the 'new depression,' with one in three Australian women expected to experience it in their lifetime. She encourages those in need to seek help from organizations like Beyond Blue and Lifeline.

Elena Curtin, a seven-months pregnant woman from Portland, Oregon, will no longer face prosecution for second-degree assault. She had been charged after striking her boyfriend's former girlfriend with a crowbar in November 2014, when she found the woman using heroin in her bathroom. Prosecutors dropped the charges, stating Curtin was justified in her actions. Oregon law permits the use of physical force against an intruder who refuses to leave. Curtin's defense highlighted the ex-girlfriend's history of harassment and attempts to sabotage her relationship with the boyfriend, who is the father of her child. If convicted, Curtin would have faced a mandatory prison sentence of nearly six years.

The passage describes a pit bull named Gemma who lives in California with her owner and two children. Gemma is shown in a video being fed treats by her owner, who tries to trick her by including a piece of broccoli. Gemma reacts with disgust and spits out the broccoli. The passage notes that it's important for the children living with Gemma to not follow her lead in disliking vegetables. When not eating, Gemma enjoys sleeping and spending time with her human family.

HSBC apologized for a mishap where a link on its official website redirected users to a pornographic site. This occurred when the bank's page for the Young Entrepreneur Awards, which was discontinued in 2011, was taken over by the adult content site after the registration on hsbc.com.hk lapsed. Upon realizing the error, HSBC removed the hyperlink from its main site and assured the public that it had no connection to the external site, apologizing for any inconvenience caused. The bank confirmed that its website remained secure and that its internet banking service, which includes checking account balances, transferring funds, and applying for loans and insurance, was unaffected.

A 13-year-old boy from Maryland, Marcus, made a 911 call on Sunday morning after a fire started on the first floor of his home in Clinton, while he and his 9-year-old sister Aaliyah were trapped in a second-floor bedroom. Marcus stayed calm during the 11-minute call, providing instructions to the dispatcher and comforting his sister. He informed the dispatcher that their older brother, mother, and step-father were also in the house. Prince George's County firefighters rescued the siblings by entering the room, breaking a window, and using a gas mask to protect Aaliyah. The siblings were taken to Children's Hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, and the other three family members escaped on their own and were taken to MedStar Hospital.

The passage describes the appearance of blue fluorescent algae along Australia's east coast, specifically in Jervis Bay, South Coast of NSW, creating a stunning, neon-lit scene at one of the country's beaches. Photographer Andy Hutchinson captured these images, describing the phenomenon as a 'beautiful supernatural scene' caused by millions of light-emitting plankton. A similar occurrence was observed at Sydney's Manly Beach in August 2014. Oceanography expert Iain Suthers from the University of New South Wales explained that the glow is produced by Noctiluca scintillans, a single-celled phytoplankton that blooms in spring and autumn, and 90% of the time, this is a natural occurrence. The algae emit light as a defense mechanism when they prey on diatoms, another type of algae.

New tests, like EndoPredict, can help determine the aggressiveness of breast cancer by pinpointing genetic markers in the tumor. After surgery, cancer cells are screened, and within days, women can learn if their risk of recurrence is high or low. For some, the risk can be as low as 5%, making chemotherapy unnecessary. Chemotherapy, while effective in killing cancer cells, has severe side effects, making its prospect daunting for some patients. The new tests offer an informed choice, potentially sparing patients from chemotherapy. Currently, most of these tests are available privately at a cost of about £2,500, but there is hope for their wider availability on the NHS. Surgeon Hemant Singhal and Professor Kefah Mokbel support the use of these tests on the NHS, considering the cost savings from avoiding chemotherapy. Patient Becca Cornford, after being diagnosed with breast cancer in both breasts, avoided chemotherapy due to a low EndoPredict score, opting for regular monitoring instead.

more than 25 women have been airlifted from royal navy ships due to pregnancy over the last nine years . hms ocean had five pregnant sailors evacuated , while hms illustrious , nicknamed ` hms lusty ' , also had at least one woman airlifted before its decommissioning . eighteen other ships , including hms dragon , hms enterprise , and hms richmond , had similar emergency evacuations . the ministry of defence confirmed a strict ` no touching ' policy at sea , implying the pregnancies occurred before boarding or during leave . this data emerged nine months after commander sarah west was flown back to the uk amid allegations of a sexual relationship with a crew member . women have served on royal navy ships since 1990 , with about 9% of personnel being female in 2014 . nearly 100 female british soldiers were repatriated from afghanistan due to pregnancy between 2006 and 2013 , and 102 women were evacuated from iraq . military rules prohibit pregnant women from serving in war zones . most pregnancies were likely conceived before deployment , but some may have occurred on tour . personnel found pregnant on operations are returned home at the first opportunity .

A drone carrying traces of radioactive material was found on the roof of the Japanese Prime Minister's residence, coinciding with a court's approval of the restart of two nuclear reactors at the Sendai nuclear power plant. The drone, spotted by a staff member, was 50 centimeters wide with four propellers, equipped with a camera, smoke flares, and a plastic bottle containing a small amount of radioactive cesium, a byproduct of nuclear reactors. The cesium amount was not harmful to humans. This incident raises concerns about potential terrorism involving drones, especially with upcoming events like the Olympics and G7 summit. Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga emphasized the need for continuous review on how to handle unmanned vehicles and prevent terrorism. Japanese law currently restricts drone flights around airports but not in most of Tokyo, including government buildings. Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was not in the residence at the time, as he was attending the Asian-African conference in Indonesia.

Lu Xincai, a security guard from Zhejiang province in eastern China, takes his 84-year-old mother, who suffers from Alzheimer's, to work with him on the back of his motorbike every day. He ties a sash around both of their waists to ensure her safety during the commute. This action was prompted by his fear of her getting lost, as she had done on occasions when she went to collect firewood. After his father's passing, Lu Xincai took on the responsibility of caring for his mother as his wife works in a different city and his son is in school. He ensures her safety by riding slowly to work and checking on her regularly while at work, where his employers have provided her with her own room. Lu Xincai feels a duty to care for his mother, likening the relationship to that of an apple, symbolizing the reciprocal care between a mother and her child.

a major study by the institute for health metrics and evaluation at the university of washington, published in the american journal of public health, has found that heavy drinking among americans rose 17.2% between 2005 and 2012, largely due to rising rates among women. the increases are driven largely by women's drinking habits as social norms change. nationwide over the course of the decade, the rate of binge drinking among women increased more than seven times the rate among men. in 2012, 8% of americans were considered heavy drinkers and 18% were binge drinkers. despite the increases in heavy drinking, the percentage of people who drink any alcohol has remained relatively unchanged over time. the study is the first to track adult drinking patterns at the county level. madison county, idaho, reported the lowest rate of binge drinking in 2012, at 6%, while menominee, wis., had the highest rate, at 36%. hancock county, tenn., had the fewest heavy drinkers (2% of residents) and esmeralda county, nev., recorded the most (22%). about 88,600 u.s. deaths were attributed to alcohol in 2010, and the cost of excessive drinking has been estimated at more than $220 billion per year. public health experts offer a number of cultural and economic explanations for the increase in excessive drinking.

The passage discusses concerns raised by UN officials about the overuse of caesarean sections by doctors, which they warn is endangering the health of women and their babies. The officials emphasize that caesareans should only be performed when medically necessary, as the procedure can lead to infections and even death. In England, over a quarter of births are now by caesarean, a rate that has more than doubled since the early 1990s. This includes an increasing number of planned caesareans for women anxious about natural childbirth. However, experts from the World Health Organization (WHO) suggest the ideal caesarean rate should be between 10-15%, considering the risks and costs. The WHO statement contradicts current NHS guidelines, which permit caesareans even without medical justification. The procedure can result in significant complications, disability, or death, and diverts funds from other patient needs. A planned caesarean costs the NHS an average of £2,369, compared to £1,665 for a natural birth. The WHO criticizes the frequency of caesareans, suggesting doctors underestimate the associated risks, with research indicating that up to one in ten caesareans may cause infections.

A woman named Michelle Filkins, 44, from West Wareham, was arrested on April 17 for allegedly breaking into a home on Martha's Vineyard, living there for at least a week, and selling the owners' belongings in a yard sale. She has been charged with breaking and entering, larceny over $250, and malicious destruction of property. The homeowner, Mark Conklin, found her in his $800,000 summer home on Court Street in Edgartown. Upon confrontation, Filkins falsely claimed ownership of the house before fleeing in a gray Nissan pickup truck. She was arrested later that day when she tried to re-enter the home. Police found a broken window covered by a blanket and were informed by a construction worker that Filkins was seen with items from the home, possibly selling them. Missing items include furniture, lamps, a painting by the owner, and household items. Filkins is due in court on May 14. The Edgartown Police Department is asking anyone who received items from the home to return them and is offering assistance for restitution. Contact can be made at 508-627-4343.

A lost iPhone was returned to its owner, Bella Crooke, after police from the Albury station on the NSW-Victoria border posted photos and messages on her Facebook page. The phone, lost at a friend's birthday party, was handed into the police station unlocked. Officers used this opportunity to post selfies and images of the phone around the station, advising Bella to put a password on her phone and informing her that her device was safe and could be collected. Bella, unaware of the posts, retrieved her phone after a security guard informed her it was at the police station. The police's humorous approach, including puns about the phone being in a 'cell' and 'charged', garnered amusement from Bella's friends and made the process of reclaiming the phone an unexpected and entertaining experience for her. Bella has since secured her phone with a password.

The passage describes a tragic incident in the Isimangaliso Wetland Park, South Africa, where a five-day-old baby hippo was killed during a fight between two adult male hippos. The calf strayed into the conflict and was caught by one of the males, who lifted and flung it into the air. The mother, who had been protecting the calf from other sub-adult hippos, was unable to intervene effectively. Tour operator Stacey Farrell witnessed the event, noting that the mother had been trying to keep other hippos away from her baby, possibly fearing they would be too rough. The calf did not survive the attack and died from its injuries hours later.

A three-bedroom apartment in Knightsbridge, one of the most expensive areas in Britain, is on the market for £575,000, significantly less than neighboring properties. However, the flat has only three years left on the lease, making the annual cost equivalent to renting in the area at around £15,000 per month. The property, described as 'unmodernised' and 'bright and well proportioned,' spans 1,990 sq/ft and includes three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a reception room, utility room, lift access, parking, and communal garden. If the lease is extended, the property's value could soar to over £6 million. A second, larger property on the same street is also for sale at £595,000 with a similar lease situation. Estate agents have noted high interest from locals, developers, and end users, despite the need for renovation and the high cost of lease extension, estimated at £3.35 to £4.5 million for a 90-year lease. The current freeholder is believed to be the Welcome Trust.

starbucks experienced a computer outage at 8,000 stores in the us and canada, which led to the company giving away free drinks. the outage, which began in the early evening on the east coast and late afternoon on the west coast, affected 7,000 stores in the us and 1,000 in canada. the cause of the outage was not explained. the company resolved the issue late friday night and expected stores to open for 'business as usual' on saturday. during the outage, some stores were still accepting cash, and baristas gave away free drinks and baked goods to customers. the outage also affected evolution fresh and teavana stores. starbucks apologized for any inconvenience and confusion caused by the outage. the company had posted record quarterly earnings with net revenues of $4.6 billion the day before the outage.

The passage discusses the discovery of terrorist training activities in rural West Wales, specifically in Ceredigion, Powys, and Pembrokeshire. According to Detective Constable Gareth Jones from the Wales Extremism and Counter Terrorism Unit, these areas are being used to radicalize Muslims. The individuals involved appear to engage in normal community activities but have hidden agendas. Jones highlights that terrorism issues are not exclusive to large cities. There are historical instances of extremist activity in Wales dating back to 1998, involving locations like the Brecon Beacons used for military training due to its rugged terrain. Notable events include the 2005 visit of two 7/7 bombers to a whitewater center in Bala and the 2010 arrest of a Cardiff-based group planning Mumbai-style attacks. Michael Adebowale, convicted of murdering Fusilier Lee Rigby, reportedly studied Arabic at the European Institute of Human Sciences near Llanybydder, which has links to Iraqi clerics. Jones emphasizes the importance of community intelligence in combating such activities.

The passage discusses the discovery of an Omura's whale, a species that was feared extinct, washed up on a remote beach in Western Australia. This is the first sighting of the species in Western Australia and only the second in Australia. The identification of the 5.68 m juvenile female whale was confirmed through DNA profiling by the Department of Parks and Wildlife. The Environment Minister, Albert Jacob, stated that the discovery is highly significant for whale scientists as very little is known about the species. The Omura's whale was first described in scientific journals in 2003 and is typically found in tropical and subtropical waters, particularly in Indonesian waters, the Philippines, and the Sea of Japan. The whale has a sleek body shape and unique skeletal features, including 53 vertebrae and four digits on each pectoral fin. The carcass has been buried, and the skeleton will be recovered in a few years for further scientific investigation and potential public display in museums.

The passage discusses the controversial opinion of Cheryl Rios, a CEO, who believes that a woman should not be president due to hormonal influences that could lead to irrational decision-making, specifically the potential to start unnecessary wars. Rios's stance is critiqued by pointing out historical examples of male leaders whose decisions were potentially influenced by male hormones, suggesting that men may take more unnecessary risks. The article highlights the bias against women in leadership roles, emphasizing that the real barrier to women's success is not biochemistry but societal bias. It argues that gender equality benefits everyone, improving corporate performance, family well-being, and societal outcomes. The piece also corrects a factual error about Canada's first female prime minister, Kim Campbell.

robert hardy, an 89-year-old veteran actor known for roles in 'all creatures great and small' and as winston churchill, is auctioning over 200 antiques from his collection in a £100,000 sale. the items, amassed over his career, include a hand-painted limewood diorama of the battle of agincourt, a yew longbow with a mother-of-pearl handle, furniture, paintings, swords, rifles, silverware, crystal chandeliers, and books dating back to the 17th century. the auction is conducted by dominic winter auctioneers in gloucestershire. hardy, a military historian and expert on the medieval longbow, expressed sadness at downsizing but hopes the new owners find joy in the items. he was taught by j.r.r. tolkien and c.s. lewis and has published books on longbow history. hardy has worked with renowned actors and appeared in 'harry potter' as cornelius fudge.

michael scott shemansky is a suspect in the murder of his mother, sandra shemansky, and has been on the run since saturday. he missed a supervised visit with his son on the day his mother's body was found at their shared home in winter garden, florida. an investigation revealed signs of foul play. shemansky is on parole for battery on law enforcement, has a history of bipolar mental illness, and attempted suicide. his mother was supporting him through a divorce, and there was a domestic violence injunction filed against him by his estranged wife. neighbors speculate that the divorce proceedings and recent bad news may have led to the incident. the murder weapon is in possession of the authorities, but the method of killing has not been disclosed. shemansky was last seen without provisions or medication. his wife is taking precautions in case he visits her home, and the public is urged to contact authorities with any information about his whereabouts.

The city of Eugene in the United States has been awarded the rights to host the 2021 IAAF World Championships, a decision made by the International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF) Council. This choice bypassed the usual bidding process due to the strategic opportunity of hosting the event in the USA for the first time. Eugene, which previously lost the bid for the 2019 event to Doha, Qatar, successfully presented its case to the IAAF, convincing them of its capability to host the championships. IAAF President Lamine Diack highlighted the unique opportunity to engage public authorities, the private sector, the national Olympic committee, NBC, and an enthusiastic public. This decision, while unconventional, is seen as beneficial for accessing a key market and promoting the global development of athletics. Notably, the 2007 World Championships in Osaka, Japan, was also awarded without a bidding process.

Leonie Granger, a 25-year-old aspiring model, has been sentenced to 16 years in prison for the manslaughter of professional gambler Mehmet Hassan, 56. Granger targeted Hassan after seeing him display a large amount of cash at a London casino. She befriended him using her looks, and he lavished her with gifts and money. One night, after going back to his flat, Granger left the door unlocked for her boyfriend and an accomplice to enter, tie up Hassan, and kick him to death while searching for his hidden winnings. Co-defendants Kyrron Jackson and Nicholas Chandler were found guilty of murder and sentenced to life with a minimum of 36 years. The judge described the attack as "pitiless and wicked." Granger was found guilty of manslaughter and sentenced to 16 years.

The passage discusses the decline in form of Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas, particularly noting his poor performance in Spain's 2-0 loss to Holland. Fabregas, who had a strong start to the season, has seen a significant drop in his performance, with questions raised about his durability. Despite his happiness at Chelsea and the team's likely success in the Premier League following a Capital One Cup win, Fabregas's role as a key player has diminished due to fatigue from an intense season. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is concerned about Fabregas's lack of impact, especially as he struggles to maintain his form as a deep-lying playmaker. Fabregas's stats show a downward trend, with only one assist in five games since mid-January, potentially falling short of Thierry Henry's record of 20 assists in a season. However, with nine games left, Fabregas has the opportunity to improve his performance against teams he has previously assisted against, which could be crucial for Chelsea's title charge. Mourinho hopes Fabregas's assist in the last game against Hull City signals a late-season resurgence.

West Ham is in talks to sign Jamaican talent Deshane Beckford, a 17-year-old forward from Montego Bay United, who has impressed during his trial with the club's academy. Beckford, considered one of the Caribbean's top young players, also has offers from Belgian clubs and has attracted interest from several European teams. Additionally, West Ham has announced that season tickets for their new Olympic Stadium home will be priced as low as £289, aiming for the most affordable pricing in the Barclays Premier League to fill the 54,000-seat stadium for the 2016-17 season.

The police have ceased their investigation into an assault on Mike Lane, a 40-year-old huntsman, which occurred three months prior, despite available evidence implicating a potential attacker. Lane, who is the joint master of the Tedworth Hunt, was attacked by masked protesters armed with iron bars and ropes, resulting in hospitalization for concussion, broken teeth, and subsequent memory loss. Despite a video of the incident and a dossier of evidence, including names and car registration numbers of saboteurs, being submitted to the Wiltshire police, the investigation has been suspended due to insufficient evidence. The police's failure to identify, charge, or prosecute anyone involved has caused disappointment among hunt supporters. Lane feels let down by the police's lack of effort and is losing trust in their ability to handle the case. The Countryside Alliance is advocating for a ban on saboteurs wearing face coverings to facilitate the prosecution of criminals. Wiltshire police have stated that the case is currently undetected but will be reopened if new evidence emerges.

here is a summary of the passage:
- adam gadahn, a us citizen and prominent member of al qaeda, was killed in a us counterterrorism operation in january 2016.
- gadahn, also known as azzam the american, was born in 1978 and converted to islam in 1995 before leaving the us for pakistan in 1998.
- he rose through the ranks of al qaeda and became the group's chief official english-language propagandist, appearing in videos threatening attacks on western targets.
- gadahn was indicted in 2006 for treason and material support to al qaeda and was among the fbi's most wanted terrorists.
- in his videos, gadahn urged muslims to target american, western, and jewish interests and praised lone-wolf attacks in the us.
- his final video was posted online in september 2014, in which he called for muslims to work to overthrow governments in saudi arabia and pakistan.
- gadahn was married to a muslim woman from afghanistan and reportedly had at least one child.

The passage highlights the emergence of a five-year-old basketball prodigy named Mai Zizhuo in China, who has been playing since he was two and a half years old. A viral video showcases his impressive skills, including scoring multiple hoops and dribbling two basketballs simultaneously while maintaining focus on the camera. His talents have garnered him a large fan base in basketball-enthusiast China, with netizens expressing disbelief and admiration, some even questioning his lineage or feeling embarrassed about their own basketball abilities in comparison. The article also mentions Yao Ming, China's most famous basketball player to date, who played for the NBA's Houston Rockets from 2002 to 2011.

Tom O'Carroll, a former key activist for the Paedophile Information Exchange (PIE) which advocated for the legalization of child sex in the 1970s and 80s, has become a supporter of the media pressure group Hacked Off. O'Carroll attended a Hacked Off rally in the Houses of Parliament on February 25 to lobby MPs for state involvement in media regulation. Hacked Off, established after the phone-hacking scandal, is against the Independent Press Standards Organisation and seeks a statutory body to regulate the press, as suggested by the Leveson Inquiry. O'Carroll's association with Hacked Off could be embarrassing for the group. PIE had formed an alliance with the National Council for Civil Liberties (NCCL), which lobbied for the age of sexual consent to be lowered and for incest to be legalized. O'Carroll was part of the NCCL's gay rights sub-committee and was imprisoned in 1981 for 'corrupting public morals'. He confirmed his attendance at the Hacked Off meeting, chaired by John Cleese, through a blog post. A Hacked Off spokesperson stated that the meeting was open to the public.

On Thursday, the Icebergs Club pool at Bondi was drained, displacing daily lap swimmers for a fashion event. The empty pool served as a catwalk for the Ten Pieces presentation during Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. Models walked through the pool and along the break wall with an ocean backdrop. Ten Pieces, a unisex clothing line by Icebergs restaurateur Maurice Terzini and partner Lucy Hinckfuss, showcased a monochrome capsule collection of ten pieces designed for 20 different wear styles. Guests enjoyed food and drinks while viewing the minimalist, androgynous designs under a clear sky and warm temperatures. Beachgoers and passers-by also watched the show from the club balcony and the road above the pool.

The passage discusses boxer Amir Khan's recent visit to a safari park in Northern California with his family, where he interacted with various animals including white tigers, giraffes, and sea lions. Additionally, it mentions that Khan has announced his next opponent, former light-welterweight world champion Chris Algieri, whom he will fight on May 30, thus ending speculation about his next bout. Khan had been under pressure to fight British rival Kell Brook and had also been linked with fights against Adrien Broner and Keith Thurman.

the name of mohammed abu khdeir, a palestinian teenager who was beaten and burned alive by three israelis, was included on an israeli memorial commemorating fallen soldiers and victims of terrorism, causing objections from his family and an organization called almagor. the family and almagor demanded his name be removed, with almagor stating that abu khdeir was not a victim of terrorism but of a rogue attack. in response to the complaints, the national insurance institute of israel, which maintains the memorial site, announced that abu khdeir's name would be removed.

The passage describes a scene where a young boy attempts to use his family cat's belly as a pillow to rest his head. This occurs in the garden of their California home, with the father, Lionel Hutz, filming the interaction. The cat, initially seen grooming itself, allows a brief moment of stillness before moving away to another spot, only to be followed by the persistent boy. This sequence repeats until the cat decides to leave for indoors, presumably to escape the situation. A subsequent video shows the boy and cat have reconciled, with the boy gently feeding the cat treats.

The passage discusses a police corruption trial in Philadelphia, where witness Robert Kushner, a former drug dealer, testified about police wrongdoing, including the alleged theft of $81,000 and 7 pounds of marijuana during his 2007 arrest. As a result of his testimony, Kushner lost his varsity coaching job at the Jack M. Barrack Hebrew Academy. The school was unaware of his past, as it was not revealed in the background check conducted when he was hired in 2010. Kushner's 2007 charges were expunged as part of a probationary sentence, and he also faced arrests in 2008 and 2011 for driving under the influence and was sentenced to four years of probation, respectively. The trial involves six former drug squad officers charged with racketeering, extortion, robbery, kidnapping, and drug dealing. The defense argues that the government's case is based on the testimonies of lying drug dealers and a rogue ex-cop. Despite his past, Kushner is described as an excellent coach and good with kids by the director of a Narberth summer league where he also coaches.

An explosion at a paraxylene (PX) chemical plant in Zhangzhou, Fujian province, China, resulted in a fire and injured six people, five of whom were hurt by broken glass. The plant, which produces a reportedly carcinogenic chemical used in polyester products, had an oil leak that led to the blast. No toxic chemical spill was reported. Over 600 firefighters controlled the fire, and residents nearby heard the explosion and felt tremors. This is not the first incident at the plant, which was previously relocated due to pollution concerns and protests in Xiamen in 2007.

Jack Grealish, the Aston Villa teenager, has a superstition about wearing his socks low and children's shinpads, which he intends to continue despite Premier League referees advising him to pull his socks up. Grealish made his first Premier League start against QPR and, despite the match ending in a 3-3 draw, he was pleased with the opportunity, seeing it as a sign of the manager's faith in him. He hopes to earn more starts before the season ends.

Bobbi Kristina Brown, the daughter of Bobby Brown and Whitney Houston, has suffered "global and irreversible brain damage," according to her grandmother, Cissy Houston. Despite no longer being in a medically induced coma, she remains unresponsive and does not react to visitors or familiar voices. She has a tracheostomy in her throat. Her father, Bobby Brown, had previously said her condition had improved, but an attorney for the family clarified that while she is out of the ICU and has opened her eyes, she has embarked on a long and hard rehabilitation process, and the quality of her life will not be known for years.

Russia is close to advancing to the Fed Cup final, securing a 2-0 lead against Germany. Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova saved a match point and defeated Sabine Lisicki in a three-set match, following Svetlana Kuznetsova's straight sets win over Julia Goerges. Pavlyuchenkova commented on Lisicki's powerful play causing her difficulties initially. Despite 13 double faults from Pavlyuchenkova and 63 unforced errors from Lisicki, the match was close, with Lisicki acknowledging she had a match point but did not play a good tiebreaker. Russia requires just one more win from the remaining three matches to reach the final and potentially win their first Fed Cup title since 2008.

residents of new south wales are bracing for more floods and damage as another storm is predicted to hit later this week, potentially affecting the region from thursday through to saturday. the impending weather system is an east coast low, similar to the one that caused devastation last week. the state emergency service (ses) is still working through over 4,000 of the 24,196 assistance requests from the previous storm and is concerned that more storms will hamper clean-up efforts. the ses is particularly worried about the hunter region, which was severely impacted by the last storm. meteorologists predict that the trough of low pressure will hit hardest in the far northern parts of the state, and while the system is expected to be less severe than the previous one, it could still cause significant issues, especially in areas with saturated ground. the ses is urging the community to prepare themselves, their homes, and their families to prevent further loss and devastation.

nina moric, a model known for appearing in ricky martin's "la vida loca" video, clarified on her instagram account that she did not attempt suicide, contrary to italian media reports. moric, who has over 40,000 followers, shared photos of bruised arms and explained she was hospitalized due to collapsing from low blood pressure. her boyfriend, luigi mario favoloso, was reported to have a different account, suggesting she tried to commit suicide. however, moric stated she was recovering at home after the incident and that the reports were not entirely correct. she mentioned her boyfriend was in naples during the accident and that she fell and hurt herself due to low blood pressure. moric was previously married to paparazzo fabrizio corona, with whom she has a son, and corona had been jailed for blackmail.

the summary is as follows:

a yougov survey for the sunday times has revealed that diana is the favourite name choice for the second child of the duke and duchess of cambridge , with 12 per cent of those polled hoping kate and william will name their daughter after the late princess of wales . alice and charlotte were the next most popular choices , with nine per cent of the vote each . if the child is a boy , james and alexander were the top choices . the poll also found that a quarter of the 2,200 people surveyed wanted the couple to have a girl , with only three per cent hoping for a boy . the majority of brits also support william 's decision to take six weeks paternity leave from his pilot job .

A suicide bombing occurred near a group of protesters in Khost, eastern Afghanistan, resulting in 17 fatalities and injuries to 64 others, including an Afghan lawmaker. The attack took place as the protesters were heading to a rally against the provincial governor. Taliban spokesman Zabiullah Mujahid denied involvement, and no other group has claimed responsibility. The incident was reported by CNN's Masoud Popalzai from Kabul and Jethro Mullen from Hong Kong, with contributions from Elizabeth Joseph.

The passage discusses the impending departure of Brazilian right-back Dani Alves from Barcelona. Alves, who has had a successful seven-year stint with the club, winning four Spanish titles and two Champions League trophies, will leave the Nou Camp this summer after rejecting Barcelona's final contract offer. The 31-year-old's agent and ex-wife, Dinorah Santana, confirmed that the negotiations are over, as they could not agree on a new deal. The rejected offer was for a three-year contract extension contingent on Alves participating in 60% of the matches. Santana expressed disappointment that the club had not renewed Alves' contract earlier.

pablo osvaldo, currently on loan at boca juniors from southampton, has suggested that andrea pirlo and francesco totti, two italian football legends, should join him at the argentinian club. osvaldo, who has scored three goals in six games for boca juniors, believes that pirlo and totti would be a good fit for the team and would be loved by the fans. he mentioned their south-american style of play and how the la bombonera stadium would be excited to have them. pirlo is recognized as one of the best midfielders globally, while totti is a roma legend, and osvaldo thinks totti would be equally adored in argentina.

The passage details the experience of 18-year-old amateur jockey Lewis Ferguson following a dramatic fall from his horse, Merrion Square, during a race at Wincanton. Despite the fall, which involved a spectacular double somersault and has garnered significant online attention, Ferguson sustained only a minor cut on his nose. He continued his routine at Paul Nicholls's yard, including mucking out stables, and expressed his intention to resume riding. Ferguson described the fall as a blur, only understanding its severity upon watching a replay in the weighing room. He was fortunate to escape serious injury and has taken the incident in good humor, even joking about a potential career in gymnastics.

here is a summary of the passage:

- the new avengers: age of ultron movie was released, and james haskell, the london wasps captain, celebrated by dressing up as iron man and posting the photo on instagram.
- the movie premiered at westfield london shopping centre, featuring a cast that includes robert downey jr., chris hemsworth, and scarlett johansson.
- haskell, an england flanker, returned to wasps for the 2012 season after playing for stade francais, ricoh black rams, and highlanders.
- he first joined wasps in 2002, played eight seasons, and won his first england cap in 2007.
- after leaving wasps in 2009, haskell played in france, japan, and new zealand before returning to england and surpassing the 100 appearance mark for wasps.
- he has become a significant part of the england squad, earning 57 caps to date.

The passage discusses the resurgence of wide leg trousers as a key trend for SS15, offering a fresh alternative to the long-dominant skinny jean. Wide leg trousers, available in various styles like denim, cropped, printed, or striped, are praised for their effortless appeal. Celebrities like Louise Redknapp endorse this trend as a welcome change. The text advises that to wear wide leg trousers successfully, especially for shorter individuals, high heels are essential to maintain proportion and elongate the leg. Denim is highlighted as the easiest way to incorporate this trend, with designer brands like Gucci and Celine featuring wide leg styles in their collections. High street brands and new labels like Finery London also offer accessible versions. The trend is versatile, suitable for both day and evening wear, and does not require good weather. Poppy Delevingne is noted for wearing wide leg trousers at the AW15 Chloe show in Paris.

The University of Michigan initially planned to cancel a screening of the film "American Sniper" due to a petition signed by over 200 students, who objected to the movie's portrayal of the Iraq War and its impact on the Middle East and people from that region. However, the university reversed its decision, stating that the cancellation was inconsistent with the institution's commitment to freedom of expression. The movie, which features Bradley Cooper as Chris Kyle, the most lethal sniper in U.S. military history, will be shown as part of the UMix series of social events. As an alternative, the university will also screen "Paddington" for students who prefer not to watch "American Sniper." This decision was commended by Michigan's head football coach, Jim Harbaugh.

two french tourists, aged 18 and 24, attempted to set a quokka alight on rottnest island off perth in western australia on april 3. they ignited an aerosol spray with a lighter, causing a flame to make contact with the animal. the quokka survived but was singed. the men were questioned by detectives, evicted from the island, and charged with animal cruelty. they are set to appear in fremantle magistrates court on april 17. quokkas, which are about the size of a domestic cat, are found on some small islands off the west australian coast, particularly rottnest island and bald island.

The passage is about 102-year-old Alice Barker, a former dancer at iconic New York venues like the Cotton Club and Cafe Zanzibar during the 1930s and 1940s. She danced alongside famous figures such as Bill "Bojangles" Robinson and Frank Sinatra. Barker had never seen footage of herself dancing as her photographs and memorabilia were lost over time. With the help of filmmakers, particularly Mark Cantor from jazz-on-film.com, a video of early music videos, known as "soundies," was compiled and shown to her at her nursing home. Barker was thrilled to finally see herself dancing, expressing her delight by calling the experience "fabulous."

The passage discusses a study by vehicle leasing firm OSV, revealing that the tradition of washing one's own car in Britain is declining. Key points include:
- A third of men have never washed their own car.
- Only 12% of those who do wash their cars do so regularly.
- Three-quarters of women do not wash their own cars, preferring car wash services.
- Only 5% of those surveyed have asked their children to wash the car for pocket money.
- Factors contributing to the decline include shops opening on Sundays, more live football on TV, the rise of hand car washes, and the size of 4x4 and off-road vehicles.
- Cars are most likely to be washed by their owners in Birmingham, Chelmsford, and Sheffield, and least likely in Oxford, Bath, and Edinburgh.
- Audis, Toyotas, and BMWs are most frequently washed by their owners, while Range Rovers, Peugeots, and Mercedes are least often washed.
- OSV spokesman Andrew Kirkley attributes the decline to lack of time, larger car sizes, and the availability of affordable car wash services.

Martin Skrtel, a Liverpool player, has commended Steven Gerrard's influence on him since joining the club in 2008, but he is confident that Liverpool can manage the task of replacing their captain. Gerrard, who is set to play in the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa, aims to lead Liverpool to the final against Arsenal before his move to LA Galaxy. Skrtel considers Gerrard one of the best players globally and a symbol of Liverpool. Despite acknowledging that the club will change without Gerrard, Skrtel believes they have potential replacements and can work as a team to fill the void. Both Skrtel and Gerrard could return to the lineup after serving bans for violent conduct in a previous match against Manchester United.

At 75 years old, Jack Nicklaus, known as the Golden Bear, hit a hole-in-one at Augusta National during the Par-3 contest, adding to his legendary career. This occurred on the 130-yard fourth hole, with the ball spinning back into the hole after sailing past the flag. Nicklaus, playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw, was cheered by an adoring crowd. This was Nicklaus's first ace at Augusta, but Camilo Villegas matched the feat and even scored another ace on the eighth hole. However, Villegas lost the title to Kevin Streelman in a play-off. Nicklaus, who became the youngest to win the Masters in 1963 and won his sixth in 1986, is one of five to complete the career grand slam.

Here is a concise summary of the passage:

- Tornado sirens sounded in Kansas on Wednesday night due to several storms that brought reports of twisters.
- A tornado was spotted 6 miles northwest of Goddard, moving northeast and posing risks to other communities.
- Nighttime tornadoes are considered the most deadly and dangerous.
- Other tornado reports came from southwestern Kansas, with three sightings near Aetna.
- Kansas wasn't the only state affected; a tornado may have touched down in Potosi, Missouri, causing wind damage, flooding, and roof damage.
- More storms are expected on Thursday in the Midwest, Mississippi River Valley, Tennessee River Valley, and near the Southern Great Lakes.

Here is a summary of the passage:

- Robert Bates, an Oklahoma reserve sheriff's deputy, has pleaded not guilty to second-degree manslaughter in the fatal shooting of Eric Harris, whom he says he intended to subdue with a Taser.
- Bates, aged 73, was working on an arrest during a weapons sting operation when the incident occurred.
- The judge granted Bates permission to travel to the Bahamas for a family vacation, a decision that has upset Harris's family, who see it as a sign of apathy.
- Bates' preliminary hearing is scheduled for July 2.
- Bates claims the shooting was accidental and has apologized to Harris's family.
- The lawyer for Harris's family alleges that Bates was not qualified for the force and received preferential treatment due to donations he made to the agency and his friendship with the sheriff.
- Allegations have been made that supervisors were told to forge Bates' records, which the Tulsa County Sheriff's Office denies.
- Bates' lawyers have released training documents to prove he had proper law enforcement training.
- Two deputies involved in Harris's arrest have been reassigned due to threats against them and their families.

Conor McGregor, aged 26, is preparing for a featherweight title fight against Jose Aldo on July 11. In anticipation of the match, McGregor has unveiled a new tattoo of a tiger's face on his stomach, adding to his existing gorilla tattoo that depicts the animal eating a heart. McGregor has shared the tiger tattoo on Instagram, commenting that seeing the tiger means it's too late, implying the tattoo symbolizes an imminent threat. McGregor and Aldo have a contentious relationship, and McGregor has accused Aldo of lacking motivation, claiming that Aldo does not want to be near him or the belt. During a promotional tour in Dublin, McGregor seized Aldo's belt in front of a crowd of 5,000 supporters. McGregor asserts that his motivation to win the title is stronger than Aldo's to defend it for the eighth time.

Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott has faced criticism from anti-drinking campaigners after he was seen 'skolling' a beer at an Australian rules function. Julie Robert, a cultural studies professor, argues that Abbott's actions glorify binge drinking and associate masculinity with heavy drinking, which she finds problematic. Abbott was cheered on by a crowd as he downed the beer in about six seconds. Critics claim that such behavior sets a culture where drinking is about quantity and speed rather than socializing. Health Minister Sussan Ley defended Abbott, suggesting that his active lifestyle negates concerns over his drinking habits. Opposition Leader Bill Shorten made a light-hearted comment about Abbott's choice of drink, referencing past criticism of Abbott for ordering a light beer. The incident has sparked debate over the role of public figures in setting drinking examples and the perpetuation of stereotypes about heavy drinking being a part of Australian masculinity.

indiana is experiencing a significant rise in hiv cases, with 120 confirmed and 10 preliminary positive cases linked to scott county, up from 106 the previous week. the increase comes as the state operates a 30-day needle exchange program approved by gov. mike pence. the program, which began on march 26, has distributed 5,322 clean syringes to 86 participants and collected 1,400 used syringes. the outbreak is primarily among intravenous drug users and involves the painkiller opana. pence is reviewing reports and will decide early next week whether to extend the program beyond april 25. the future of the program and legislation allowing needle exchanges in other counties is uncertain, with pence opposing such exchanges as an anti-drug policy. senate president pro tem david long is unsure if the senate will support a bill allowing 23 indiana counties with high rates of hepatitis c to establish needle-exchange programs. the centers for disease control and prevention reports that 50-90% of people with hepatitis c are also infected with hiv, making high rates of hepatitis c a key indicator of needle-sharing and potential hiv outbreaks. the house approved the bill on april 7, and it is scheduled for a hearing on monday. funding is also a concern, as the federal government has banned public funding of needle exchange programs since 1989, and pence's executive order did not include money for the scott county program.

An obsessive Arsenal fan gave his girlfriend a football quiz about the club to test her knowledge. She scored 43.5 out of 50, or 87%, which impressed her boyfriend enough that he decided not to break up with her. The test was formatted like a school exam, including multiple-choice questions, tables to complete, and a section to answer in her own words. Among the questions were inquiries about the club's nickname, the current manager, and comparisons between players. Saskia's boyfriend provided feedback that she could have done better on certain questions, such as understanding player positions and the rivalry with Tottenham. Despite some errors, like misidentifying player positions, Saskia received praise for creative answers, like explaining why Alexis Sanchez is better than Eden Hazard. Her boyfriend graded her with an 'A' and shared the results on Twitter, where the response was mixed, with some calling him a 'legend' and others thinking he had gone too far.
